intro: Aglaia turczaninowii, commonly known as the Philippine aglaia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Aglaia turczaninowii is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, growing in shaded environments.
